sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens on Sunday staged its biggest fireworks display ever to mark a royal succession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: ever to mark a royal succession. Frederick X is now the King of Denmark, following the formal abdication of his mother, Queen Margaretha II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It had been a day of celebration for the Nordic nation, as it experienced its first royal succession in more than half a century, and one not caused by the death of a monarch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Earlier tens of thousands of Danes had gathered in front of the Christianborg Palace in Copenhagen, where the royal succession was taking place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Unlike in the UK, there's no coronation ceremony in Denmark. The abdication leaves the country with two queens. Margrethe keeps her title, while Friedrich's Australian-born wife becomes Queen Mary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And Friedrich and Mary's eldest son Christian has become Crown Prince and heir to the throne.
